newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech key April M2 +6.2 pct yr/yr excluding SPT.
newsitem.headline: Czech key April M2 +6.2 pct yr/yr excluding SPT.

text.p: The Czech National Bank's (CNB) key money supply measure, M2, grew 6.2 percent, year-on-year in April, excluding the influence of funds from the selloff of a stake in telephone operator SPT Telecom, the CNB said.
The statement added that with SPT funds included, year-on-year money supply growth for April was 5.3 percent.
In March, M2 grew 7.3 percent, year-on-year, without the influence of SPT funds, and 6.3 percent including the $1.32 billion from the 1995 equity expansion and sale of a stake in SPT.

The statement added that the total volume of crown and foreign currency credits in April rose 11.6 percent, year-on-year, after 9.5 percent growth the previous month, while total crown and foreign currency deposits, which include the SPT funds, grew 4.6 percent from 5.5 percent in March.
The statement said the average interest rate for new crown credits in April was 13.43 percent, some 10 basis points lower than in March.
CZECH M2 MONEY APRIL 1997 MARCH 1997 APRIL 1996
* Includes domestic deposits connected to the $1.32 billion equity expansion of SPT Telecom a.s. in the summer of 1995.
